sen.j: 早良親王（さわらしんのう、天平勝宝2年（750年）？ - 延暦4年9月28日 (旧暦)（785年11月8日））は、奈良時代末期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Sawara (750? - November 8, 785) is one of the Imperial family members of the late Nara period.
Imperial Prince Sawara (750? - November 8, 785) is one of the Imperial family members of the late Nara period.
Imperial Prince Sawara (750? - November 8, 785) is one of the Imperial family members of the late Nara period.
He is an imperial prince of Emperor Konin.
He was the imperial prince of Emperor Konin.
sen.cmt: 時制が違います。定冠詞が必要です。
sen.e: He was the imperial prince of Emperor Konin.
His mother is TAKANO no Niigasa.
His mother was TAKANO no Niigasa.
His mother was TAKANO no Niigasa.

sen.j: 桓武天皇、能登内親王の同母弟。
sen.e: He is a younger maternal half-brother of Emperor Kammu and Imperial Princess Noto.
sen.cmt: 「桓武天皇」は"Emperor Kammu"という表記に統一しました。
sen.e: He was the younger maternal half-brother of Emperor Kanmu and Imperial Princess Noto.
sen.cmt: 時制が違います。定冠詞が必要です。スタイル違反(mの前はn)です。
sen.e: He was the younger maternal half-brother of Emperor Kanmu and Imperial Princess Noto.

sen.j: 母方が下級貴族であったために立太子は望まれていなかった。
sen.e: Since his maternal family was lower-ranking nobles, no one wanted him to be the investiture of the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Since his maternal family was lower-ranking nobles, no one wanted him to be the investiture of the Crown Prince.
Since his maternal family was lower-ranking nobles, no one wanted him to be the investiture of the Crown Prince.

sen.j: そのため、761年に出家して東大寺羂索院や大安寺東院に住み、親王禅師と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: Because of this, he entered into priesthood in 761, lived in Kensakuin in Todai-ji Temple and east building of Daian-ji Temple, and he was called Imperial Prince Zenji.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Because of this, he entered into priesthood in 761, living in Kensakuin in the Todai-ji Temple and in the east building of Daian-ji Temple, and was called Imperial Prince Zenji.
sen.cmt: 定冠詞が必要です。文の流れを自然にするため、一部単語を修正、削除しました。
sen.e: Because of this, he entered into priesthood in 761, living in Kensakuin in the Todai-ji Temple and in the east building of Daian-ji Temple, and was called Imperial Prince Zenji.

sen.j: 781年、兄・桓武天皇の即位と同時に光仁天皇の勧めによって還俗し、立太子。
sen.e: In 781, when his older brother Emperor Kammu ascended the throne, he returned to secular life following Emperor Konin's advice, and he became the investiture of the Crown Prince.
In 781, when his older brother Emperor Kanmu ascended the throne, he returned to secular life following Emperor Konin's advice becoming the investiture of the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: スタイル違反(mの前はn)です。文の流れを自然にするため、一部単語を修正しました。
sen.e: In 781, when his older brother Emperor Kanmu ascended the throne, he returned to secular life following Emperor Konin's advice becoming the investiture of the Crown Prince.

sen.j: だが785年、造長岡宮使 藤原種継暗殺事件に連座して廃された。
sen.e: However, in 785, he was uncrowned because he was alleged to be implicated in assassination of Zounagaokagushi (the administrator in charge of building the new capital called Nagaoka-kyo) FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外処理 ・「造長岡宮使」は「ぞうながおかきゅうし」と「ぞうながおかぐうし」の2つの読み方がありますが、「ぞうながおかぐうし」のほうがヒット件数が多かったのでそちらを採用しました。
sen.e: However, in 785, he was uncrowned because he was alleged to have been implicated in the assassination of Zonagaokagushi (the administrator in charge of building the new capital called Nagaoka-kyo) FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu.
sen.cmt: 文法が違います。(to be→to have been)定冠詞が必要です。スタイル違反(長音表記にouは不可)です。
sen.e: However, in 785, he was uncrowned because he was alleged to have been implicated in the assassination of Zonagaokagushi (the administrator in charge of building the new capital called Nagaoka-kyo) FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu.

sen.j: 無実を訴えるため絶食して淡路国に配流の途中、河内国高瀬橋付近で憤死した。
sen.e: He did not eat anything in order to plead his innocence, but he ended up with dying in a fit of anger or indignation around Takase-bashi Bridge, Kawachi Province, on the way to be exiled to Awaji Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He fasted to plead his innocence, but he ended up dying in a fit of anger or indignation around Takase-bashi Bridge, Kawachi Province, on the way to be exiled to Awaji Province.
sen.cmt: 単語を修正し、不要な前置詞を削除しました。
sen.e: He fasted to plead his innocence, but he ended up dying in a fit of anger or indignation around Takase-bashi Bridge, Kawachi Province, on the way to be exiled to Awaji Province.

sen.j: 藤原種継暗殺に早良親王が関与していたかどうかは不明である。
sen.e: It is unclear whether Imperial Prince Sawara was involved in the assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu.
It is unclear whether Imperial Prince Sawara was involved in the assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu.
It is unclear whether Imperial Prince Sawara was involved in the assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu.

sen.j: だが、東大寺の開山である良弁が死の間際に当時僧侶として東大寺にいた親王禅師（早良親王）に後事を託したとされること（『東大寺華厳別供縁起』）、また東大寺が親王の還俗後も寺の大事に関しては必ず親王に相談してから行っていたこと（実忠『東大寺権別当実忠二十九ヶ条』）などが伝えられている。
sen.e: However, it is said that Roben, who was a founder and the first chief priest of the Todai-ji Temple, asked Imperial Prince Zenji (Imperial Prince Sawara) to take care of affairs in the future("Todai-ji Kegon no Bekkyo Engi"), and that the priests in Todai-ji Temple were sure to consult Imperial Prince Sawara about important affairs of the temple even after he returned to the secular life (Jitchu "Todai-ji Associated Grand Abbot Jitchu Twenty Nine Articles").
sen.cmt: 「東大寺華厳別供縁起」の読み方不明
sen.e: However, it is said that Roben, who was the founder and the first chief priest of the Todai-ji Temple, asked Imperial Prince Zenji (Imperial Prince Sawara) to take care of affairs in the future ("Todai-ji Kegon no Bekkyo Engi"), and that the priests in Todai-ji Temple were sure to consult Imperial Prince Sawara about important affairs of the temple even after he returned to the secular life (Jitchu "Todai-ji Associated Grand Abbot Jitchu Twenty Nine Articles").
sen.cmt: 定冠詞が必要です。futureと(の間のスペースが抜けています。「東大寺華厳別供縁起」の読み方は不明です。
sen.e: However, it is said that Roben, who was the founder and the first chief priest of the Todai-ji Temple, asked Imperial Prince Zenji (Imperial Prince Sawara) to take care of affairs in the future ("Todai-ji Kegon no Bekkyo Engi"), and that the priests in Todai-ji Temple were sure to consult Imperial Prince Sawara about important affairs of the temple even after he returned to the secular life (Jitchu "Todai-ji Associated Grand Abbot Jitchu Twenty Nine Articles").

sen.j: 種継が中心として行っていた長岡京造営の目的の1つには東大寺や大安寺などの奈良寺院の影響力排除があった。
sen.e: One of the purposes of construction of Nagaoka-kyo led by Tanetsugu was to eliminate all influence by Nara Temples, including Todai-ji Temple and Daian-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: One of the purposes in the construction of Nagaoka-kyo led by Tanetsugu was to eliminate all influences by Nara Temples, including the Todai-ji Temple and the Daian-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一部、文法を修正しました。定冠詞が必要です。
sen.e: One of the purposes in the construction of Nagaoka-kyo led by Tanetsugu was to eliminate all influences by Nara Temples, including the Todai-ji Temple and the Daian-ji Temple.

sen.j: そのため、南都寺院とつながりが深い早良親王が遷都の阻止を目的として種継暗殺を企てたという疑いをかけられたとする見方もある。
sen.e: This is why some people think that Imperial Prince Sawara, who was close with Nanto-jiin (temples in Nara Prefecture), was alleged to assassin FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu in order to stop transferring the capital.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: This is why some people think that Imperial Prince Sawara, who was close with Nanto-jiin (temples in Nara Prefecture), was alleged to have assassinated FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu in order to stop transferring the capital.
sen.cmt: 文法が違います。(to assassin→to have assasinated)
sen.e: This is why some people think that Imperial Prince Sawara, who was close with Nanto-jiin (temples in Nara Prefecture), was alleged to have assassinated FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu in order to stop transferring the capital.

sen.j: その後、桓武天皇の長男平城天皇（後の平城天皇）の発病や桓武天皇妃藤原乙牟漏の病死などが相次いだ。
sen.e: After Imperial Prince Sawara's death, terrible incidents came out one after another, for example, Emperor Heizei, the oldest son of Emperor Kammu, fell ill, and FUJIWARA no Otomuro, the wife of Emperor Kammu, died from sick.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: After Imperial Prince Sawara's death, terrible incidents came one after another, for example: Emperor Heizei, the oldest son of Emperor Kanmu, fell ill, and FUJIWARA no Otomuro, the wife of Emperor Kanmu, died with sickness.
sen.cmt: スタイル違反(mの前はn)です。一部、文法を修正しました。
sen.e: After Imperial Prince Sawara's death, terrible incidents came one after another, for example: Emperor Heizei, the oldest son of Emperor Kanmu, fell ill, and FUJIWARA no Otomuro, the wife of Emperor Kanmu, died with sickness.

sen.j: それらは早良親王の祟りであるとして幾度か鎮魂の儀式が執り行われた。
sen.e: Since people thought that the curse of Imperial Prince Sawara caused these unfortunate events, several ceremonies were held for the repose of his soul.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Since people believed the curse of Imperial Prince Sawara caused these unfortunate events, several ceremonies were held for the repose of his soul.
Since people believed the curse of Imperial Prince Sawara caused these unfortunate events, several ceremonies were held for the repose of his soul.

sen.j: 800年、崇道天皇と追称され、大和国に移葬された。
sen.e: In 800, he was given the posthumous name "Emperor Sudo," and his body was transferred to Yamato Province and buried there.
In 800, he was given the posthumous name "Emperor Sudo," and his body was transferred to Yamato Province and was buried there.
sen.cmt: buriedの前のbe動詞が抜けています。
sen.e: In 800, he was given the posthumous name "Emperor Sudo," and his body was transferred to Yamato Province and was buried there.

sen.j: その場所は奈良市八嶋町の崇道天皇陵に比定されている。
sen.e: That place is identified with "Sudo Tenno Ryo" (the mausoleum of Emperor Sudo) in Yashima Town, Nara City.
That place is identified with "Sudo Tenno Ryo" (the mausoleum of Emperor Sudo) in Yashima Town, Nara City.
That place is identified with "Sudo Tenno Ryo" (the mausoleum of Emperor Sudo) in Yashima Town, Nara City.

sen.j: またこの近くには親王を祀る社である八嶋神社があり、さらに北に数キロ離れた奈良町にある崇道天皇社、御霊神社などでも親王は祭神として祀られている。
sen.e: Also, Yashima shrine, which is the shrine to worship Imperial Prince Sawara, is near there, and he is also worshipped as an enshrined deity in Emperor Sudo shrine and Mitama shrine in Nara town, several kilometers north of Yashima town.

Moreover, Yashima shrine, which enshrines Imperial Prince Sawara, is near there, and he is also enshrined as a deity in Emperor Sudo Shrine and Goryo Shrine in Nara town, several kilometers north of Yashima town.
sen.cmt: 用語が統一(祀るはenshrine)されていません。文の流れを自然にするため、一部修正しました。shrineのsは大文字です。御霊神社は「ごりょうじんじゃ」だと思われます。http://takaoka.zening.info/Nara/Nara/Nara_machi/Goryo_jinja_Shrine.htm
sen.e: Moreover, Yashima shrine, which enshrines Imperial Prince Sawara, is near there, and he is also enshrined as a deity in Emperor Sudo Shrine and Goryo Shrine in Nara town, several kilometers north of Yashima town.

sen.j: その他にも近辺には親王を祀る寺社が点在している。
sen.e: Some temples and shrines worshipping Imperial Prince Sawara are dotted around there.
Some temples and shrines enshrining Imperial Prince Sawara are dotted around there.
